DataElement.preferredName: Patient Coagulation Disorder Or Bleeding Diathesis Evidence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating that a patient has evidence of a coagulation disorder or bleeding diathesis that meets the eligibility criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Coagulation Disorder Or Bleeding Diathesis Evidence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal coagulation properties of the blood._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A coagulation disorder characterized by a tendency for excessive bleeding._Knowledge on which to base belief._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Coagulation Disorder Or Bleeding Diathesis Evidence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria

Concepts.definition: A condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal coagulation properties of the blood.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A coagulation disorder characterized by a tendency for excessive bleeding.
Knowledge on which to base belief.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have evidence of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of coagulopathy or bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have familial coagulopathic diseases (e.g. hemophilia, von Willebrand disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of active bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of bleeding diathesis or clinically significant coagulopathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of active bleeding or bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have evidence of bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy (including clinically significant hemoptysis)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known coagulopathy or bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled coagulopathy or a bleeding disorder

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of active clinically significant bleeding?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have clinically significant bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy, including known platelet function disorders?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of bleeding diathesis or coagulopathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active bleeding diatheses?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled coagulopathy or a bleeding disorder unless directly attributable to their AML (e.g., disseminated intravascular coagulation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have uncontrolled coagulopathy or a bleeding disorder?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have recent history or current evidence of bleeding disorder (i.e. any CTCAE Grade greater than or equal to 2 hemorrhage/bleeding event within 28 days before the start of treatment)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history of bleeding diathesis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled to the atezolizumab + bevacizumab combination arm, does patient have evidence of bleeding diathesis or significant coagulopathy (with or without current therapeutic anticoagulation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have known inherited or acquired bleeding disorders?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have bleeding diathesis or clinically significant bleeding within the past 6 months?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have uncontrolled symptomatic disseminated intravascular coagulopathy with active bleeding or signs of thrombosis?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of inherited bleeding diathesis or significant coagulopathy at risk of bleeding (i.e., in the absence of therapeutic anticoagulation)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of bleeding diathesis or clinically significant coagulopathy within the past 3 months (ex: serious, non-healing or dehiscing wound, active ulcer, or untreated bone fracture)

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 12.10.2023 AQT added per request ticket CADSR0003202_mmt
